name: AGameModeBase
doc:
The GameModeBase defines the game being played. It governs the game rules, scoring, what actors
are allowed to exist in this game type, and who may enter the game.

It is only instanced on the server and will never exist on the client.

A GameModeBase actor is instantiated when the level is initialized for gameplay in
C++ UGameEngine::LoadMap().

The class of this GameMode actor is determined by (in order) either the URL ?game=xxx,
the GameMode Override value set in the World Settings, or the DefaultGameMode entry set
in the game's Project Settings.

@see https://docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Gameplay/Framework/GameMode/index.html

OptionsString: Save options string and parse it when needed
GameSessionClass: Class of GameSession, which handles login approval and online game interface
GameStateClass: Class of GameState associated with this GameMode.
PlayerControllerClass: The class of PlayerController to spawn for players logging in.
PlayerStateClass: A PlayerState of this class will be associated with every player to replicate relevant player information to all clients.
DefaultPawnClass: The default pawn class used by players.
SpectatorClass: The pawn class used by the PlayerController for players when spectating.
ReplaySpectatorPlayerControllerClass: The PlayerController class used when spectating a network replay.
DefaultPlayerName: The default player name assigned to players that join with no name specified.
GameNetDriverReplicationSystem:
Can be used to request a specific replication system for a GameNetDriver that will replicate this game mode.
Leave to Default to use the game engine's preferred system.
Useful when migrating from one repsystem to another and a game mode does not fully support both repsystem yet.
bUseSeamlessTravel: Whether the game perform map travels using SeamlessTravel() which loads in the background and doesn't disconnect clients
bStartPlayersAsSpectators: Whether players should immediately spawn when logging in, or stay as spectators until they manually spawn

methods.name: CanSpectate
methods.doc: Return whether Viewer is allowed to spectate from the point of view of ViewTarget.

methods.name: ChangeName
ChoosePlayerStart
FindPlayerStart
GetDefaultPawnClassForController
methods.doc: Returns default pawn class for given controller

methods.name: GetNumPlayers
methods.doc: Returns number of active human players, excluding spectators

methods.name: GetNumSpectators
methods.doc: Returns number of human players currently spectating

methods.name: HandleStartingNewPlayer
methods.doc: Signals that a player is ready to enter the game, which may start it up

methods.name: HasMatchEnded
methods.doc: Returns true if the match can be considered ended

methods.name: HasMatchStarted
methods.doc: Returns true if the match start callbacks have been called

methods.name: InitializeHUDForPlayer
methods.doc: Initialize the AHUD object for a player. Games can override this to do something different

methods.name: InitStartSpot
methods.doc: Called from RestartPlayerAtPlayerStart, can be used to initialize the start spawn actor

methods.name: K2_FindPlayerStart
OnChangeName
OnLogout
methods.doc: Implementable event when a Controller with a PlayerState leaves the game.

methods.name: OnRestartPlayer
methods.doc: Implementable event called at the end of RestartPlayer

methods.name: OnSwapPlayerControllers
methods.doc: Called when a PlayerController is swapped to a new one during seamless travel

methods.name: OnPostLogin
methods.doc: Notification that a player has successfully logged in, and has been given a player controller

methods.name: MustSpectate
methods.doc: Returns true if NewPlayerController may only join the server as a spectator.

methods.name: PlayerCanRestart
methods.doc: Returns true if it's valid to call RestartPlayer. By default will call Player->CanRestartPlayer

methods.name: ResetLevel
methods.doc:
Overridable function called when resetting level. This is used to reset the game state while staying in the same map
Default implementation calls Reset() on all actors except GameMode and Controllers

methods.name: RestartPlayer
methods.doc: Tries to spawn the player's pawn, at the location returned by FindPlayerStart

methods.name: RestartPlayerAtPlayerStart
methods.doc: Tries to spawn the player's pawn at the specified actor's location

methods.name: RestartPlayerAtTransform
methods.doc: Tries to spawn the player's pawn at a specific location

methods.name: ReturnToMainMenuHost
methods.doc: Return to main menu, and disconnect any players

methods.name: ShouldReset
SpawnDefaultPawnAtTransform
SpawnDefaultPawnFor
StartPlay
methods.doc: Transitions to calls BeginPlay on actors.
